dialogues.text: over BLACK SCREEN, with PORTENTOUS SPOOKY MUSIC underneat music reaches its crescendo, we hear a simian SCREECH. A BUCK-TOOTHED CARTOON MONKEY swings past on a vine. TITL him: MONKEYBONE(tm) in

dialogues.text: A POCKETWATCH swings back and forth in F.G. Gaping at it bespectacled CARTOON CHARACTER, sucking his thumb as his and forth. After a moment, the LEFT EYE freezes in place eye keeps going back and forth with the watch. SHRINK'S VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back, Stanley...you're going back...back to when it all began. Are you going back yet? Come on, get back, ve haven't got all day. Now BOTH EYES are locked in place. The patient is hypnoti

dialogues.text: A squat, lumpy TEACHER, MISS HUDLAPP, is straining to era Gettysburg Address, which is written along the very top o blackboard. There's an obtrusive, rhythmic BANGING noice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was third grade. The teacher was Miss Hudlapp. She was kinda squat and lumpy - she smelled funny - but she was kind.

dialogues.speaker: CLASS
dialogues.text: (turning around suddenly) How many times have I told you? In this class we do not pound tenpenny nails into Stanley's head!

dialogues.speaker: ON STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hapless ten-year-old STANLEY, still goofy and bespectacle front-row desk. NAILS stick out of his head. The FOUR MEA around him lower their hammers and return to their seats, A dreamy SMILE crosses STANLEY's face as he gazes at MISS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how some teachers have those, kind of, flaps on their arms - those big sacks of limp flab that like, dangle? As MISS HUDLAPP pulls her sweater off, TWO MASSIVE ARM-FL gallons of flab apiece - SPILL OUT and SMACK INTO THE FLO MISS HUDDLAPP claps two erasers together, kicking up a cl Young STANLEY watches, transfixed by her massive ARM FLAP on the gigantic ARM FLAPS as they swing hypnotically back with a loud SLAP each time they collide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds weird...but for some reason, as I watched those big old flaps of hers, I began to feel...well...oddly... Now we TRACK IN on the mesmerized STANLEY. A SONG comes u Donna Summer, "I FEEL LOVE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...aroused. (beat) And then the horror began. DOINK! STANLEY looks down at his LAP in horror. The boys around him are pointing and tittering. Grimacing in embarrassment, he discreetly places a heavy his lap, suppressing the bulge in his pants. But SPROING! goes flying across the room. The BULGE is fighting back! The kids DUCK AND COVER beneath their desks as STANLEY sl textbooks onto his lap. It's no use - the WHOLE STACK goe BOOKS come raining down on the entire class! Now MISS HUD directly at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young man. What's that in your lap? She marches toward him. STANLEY pulls his BACKPACK over h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was useless. Like putting a baseball cap on the Washington Monument. And then...all at once ...there he was. The BACKPACK bucks and wriggles, as if something inside i OUT. And then - with a flourish of rousing disco strings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkeybone!! The libidinous cartoon monkey BURSTS OUT of the backpack, HUDLAPP - and announces, in his Barry White baritone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo-oo-ooh, baby. I love your way. KC and the SUNSHINE BAND comes up underneath as MONKEYBON front of the class. He grabs MISS HUDLAPP by the hands an dancing The Bump with her ARM FLAPS. Butt left, WHAP. But The KIDS are bug-eyed - agog. With each WHAP their little back and forth as if they're watching a nude tennis match

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roomful of LIVE HUMANS watching the cartoon, heads turn with the kids onscreen. TV-INDUSTRY HIPSTERS, AD EXECS, M REPS...they're all guests at this sneak preview of the Mo and they're LAUGHING UPROARIOUSLY. In the midst of the crowd is a handsome young couple: JUL STU MILEY. JULIE's a research scientist, brainy, professi abnormally well-adjusted - and pretty enough that she'd b if it weren't for a prominent goofy streak. STU is the one guy in the auditorium who isn't laughing a on the screen. In fact, he's solemn as a judge - peering around to see how the rest of the audience is responding. Why? Because he's the cartoonist who created the characte In his looks (gangly, disheveled) and manner (sardonic, s deprecating), he's the obvious model for the character of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the monkey dance continues, we ZOOM IN on the mortifie LITTLE STANLEY. His eyes begin doing the familiar HYPNO-S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CUCKOO pops out of a wall clock. ADULT STANLEY'S THUMB mouth. He awakens from his trance in a cold sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, Doc? Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not overnight. These imaginary monkey cases take time. I vould estimate...roughly... On the desk is a CATALOGUE, open to a two-page spread dep foot CABIN CRUISER. "NEW FOR SUMMER! ONLY $229,999.95!" W hand, the SHRINK is working a CALCULATOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve years and three months ought to do it. The SHRINK hustles STANLEY to the door and shakes his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One question, doc - what did you mean when you said "imaginary"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in good time, my boy. All in good time. The SHRINK shoves STANLEY out and slams the door behind h Then he doubles over, WEEPING with LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vot a crackpot! Monkey on ze back - HAH!! ROLL

dialogues.speaker: OUT ZE WACKY WAGON
dialogues.text: Now he notices a BACKPACK, which STANLEY has left on the TWITCHES slightly - of its own free will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imaginary, huh? You quack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WINDOW shatters. The SHRINK comes hurtling out. MONKEYB HIM like Slim Pickens riding an H-bomb, hootin' and holle way down to the street. SPLAT! A gob of gore hits STANLEY in the face as he exits He kneels on the sidewalk - finding a PIPE and a GOATEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Monkeybone! At this rate I'll never find a good shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys are a waste of money! I'll show you how to stop sucking your thumb... MONKEYBONE sticks his thumb in his butt as he and STANLEY into the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANDING O from the crowd as the cartoon ends and the lig HERB, an all-purpose sidekick type, appears at the podium

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...that's our pilot...the good news is, Comedy Channel has just picked us up with an order for six new episodes! HERB leads a round of APPLAUSE. JULIE nudges STU - the on room who's still in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's give it up for the guy who started it all. Creator of America's most disturbed comic strip...the man behind the monkey...Mister Stu Miley! A SPOTLIGHT hits him, and he STANDS to tumultuous applaus genuinely stunned. He can't believe it's happening. JULIE surreptitiously PINCHES him on the bottom, giving h WINKS at him. He shoots her a small private smile - then at the adoring crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU working his way through a crowd of well-wishers and F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't actually draw all the animation, no. We have sweatshop workers who couldn't get jobs at Nike doing that. A beautiful, heavily-pierced FEMALE FAN hands STU a marke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miley, would you draw Monkeybone on my belly? As a guide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guide...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my tattoo artist? She exposes her taut midriff. STU thinks for a moment, th work. When he's done, Monkeybone appears to be climbing o girl's pants and WAVING to her. Nearby FANS APPLAUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! You have to draw the rest of him - She begins unbuckling her belt so STU will have enough ro Monkeybone's bottom half. STU demurs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - I have to, uh, check in with my doctor. DO-

dialogues.speaker: OCCCC
dialogues.text: He wanders across the room, finds JULIE deep in conversat bunch of other GUESTS, and pulls her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc. Come here. There's something really cool I want to show you. He grabs her by the sleeve, pulls her across the floor to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing "cool" about it - it's a stairway landing fire doors that open onto the parking lot outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See these doors? The cool thing is, you go out ...they close...you can't get back in! He opens one door and holds it for JULIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to leave? But Stu - you're a big hit! Everyone loves you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't love me. They love Monkeybone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you who got the standing O. It was you drawing on the belly over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was especially Monkeybone. Come on, Doc, I don't want to be stuck here with this bunch of media creeps. I just want to be us. Home. Alone! (conspiratorially) I have something I have to give you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you give it to me later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could, but the thing is, if later got here sooner, it would be...better. He gives up trying to explain...pulls her close and kisse moment they completely forget about the party in the next Then HERB appears behind them, trying to catch STU's eye the clinch to break up. Finally he pries them apart:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Julie - won't be a minute. Now Stu - I know you don't like the idea, but you really ought to talk to these guys -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and I - we were just gonna go... But before STU knows what's hit him, HERB is leading him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go? There's a potload of money here, pal. You got three major toy companies...you got the guys from Burger God over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burger God. The ones that found the pig hair in the french fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never proven. They're ready to pop for a pre- emptive endorsement. Kids love Burger God - The MERCHANDISERS shoot STU an expectant wave. STU waves in the opposite direction. HERB grabs him by the sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb, it's too much. It's all out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what kind of opportunity you have here? You gotta strike. I'm talking mansions. Lamborghinis. Champagne for mouthwash when you brush your teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be rich. It's just a trap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being rich is not a trap. That is a dirty lie perpetuated by rich people to keep the failures from killing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the ring. (beat) Tonight's the night, Herb. Tonight's the night. He nods toward JULIE, who's at the open bar grabbing two punch. HERB realizes a proposal is in the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...you're proposing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life was totally crappy, Herb, and she... fixed it. She made me happy. Which I'd never been. She loves me the way I am - right now. (beat) I don't want everything to change. I don't want her saying yes to some big success. I just want her saying yes to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...In some weird way I respect that. JULIE's over by the punchbowl. She sees the two boys star conspiratorially - MAKES A FACE at them as she waves back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then. If I get you out of here - you pop the question - tonight. Or else. Get me? STU nods gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU, JULIE, and HERB in the parking lot. A small safari o loading enormous boxes full of MONKEYBONE JUNK into STU's stuffed dolls, action figures, board games, lunchboxes, b team jackets and more! STU groans at the sight of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just prototypes...take 'em home and look at 'em before you say no... (scanning the streets) If you could just hold on a minute or two, we're expecting a couple more trucks. STU GLOWERS at HERB as he opens the car door for JULIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! You're a beautiful couple. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU backs out of his space. The small parking lot is full TRUCKS from would-be merchandisers - all too large for th they're parked in. STU has to keep backing up because the blocked. It's like negotiating a labyrinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this! He won't let us leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey!! He's everywhere! He'll take over both our lives if we let him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu - stop it. That monkey is good luck. You thought him up, and everybody loves him, and he's probably going to make you rich. So relax! Enjoy it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying. It's weird, that's all. I never had any good luck, until I met you...what if it's all just another bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the "bad" part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing; taking his hand) If you do, I'll be right there beside you. So face it. You're just going to have to be happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy. It just so happens this is the happiest night of my life. He says it so solemnly that she cracks up. After a moment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PLASTIC BANNER stretches between two poles on either si to the lot. It shows MONKEYBONE in a typical languorous p It's His World. We Just Live in It!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunday Nights This Fall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GUYS on EXTENSION LADDERS are taking the sign down as idles at the exit below. There's a strong wind tonight, a LOSES HOLD of his end of the banner just as he gets it de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STU pulls into the intersection he sees a DELIVERY TRU in the opposite lane, with a cardboard likeness of MONKEY atop the cab. He chuckles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That damn monkey is everywh-- Suddenly his view of the street DISAPPEARS. The MONKEYBON fallen DIRECTLY ACROSS HIS WINDSHIELD, like a huge SHROUD see is a great, grinning MONKEY FACE!! JULIE SCREAMS. STU SCREAMS. Unable to see, he slams on th JERKS THE WHEEL RIGHT. Off screen: HORNS BLARING. TIRES SQUEALING. The horrible ON METAL. But Stu's car comes to a halt untouched. After a moment h eyes...and JULIE opens hers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we just - hit something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?? She thinks it over, nods. STU takes a moment to catch his opens the door gingerly. A HORN BLARES as a car speeds pa opposite lane, nearly taking STU's door off. He jumps bac waits, opens the door again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes widen in horror as he steps out to survey the sc asphalt is strewn with MONKEYBONE MERCHANDISE - stuffed d lunchboxes. SKID MARKS show where the TRUCK which was car SWERVED... ...and slammed into the rear of a BUICK REGAL, pinning it TELEPHONE POLE. STU races up to the Buick. Its front end like an accordion, but the occupants - a couple of TEENAG the prom - seem to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Are you guys all right in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stupid monkey banner! It fell on my windshield - it practically killed us all! (to JULIE) God, Julie, if anything had happened to you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, baby. We're all okay. We were lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better go report this... He spots a PHONE BOOTH and starts across the street. On t plucks a STUFFED MONKEYBONE DOLL off the pavement and CHO both hands. JULIE stays behind with the prom kids. The TEENAGE BOY in glassy-eyed, miserable beyond description.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's car? The BOY begins to SOB softly. JULIE nods in sympathy. Then: EVERYONE WINCES. The air is full of a horrible CREA like nails on a blackboard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Did you hear that? The horrible CREAKING NOISE continues. JULIE turns. Behin TELEPHONE POLE that the car slammed into is beginning to TOPPLES. Directly toward...

dialogues.speaker: ON STU
dialogues.text: He sees JULIE running toward him and holds up a single fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator? I want to report an accident. Finally he glances up - just in time to see the TELEPHONE down toward the phone booth like a gigantic sledgehammer. widen. The STUFFED MONKEYBONE slips from his grasp...

dialogues.speaker: MONKEYBONE
dialogues.text: A HORRIBLE CRASH. SCREAMS. CAMERA ZEROES IN on the MONKEY STU was holding, surrounded by broken glass, its face twi insane, almost macabre grin. The screen fades to PITCH BLACK for a few seconds...until DISTANT SIREN, and an IMAGE comes swimming into focus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the back of an ambulance, with PARAMEDICS all aro working feverishly. JULIE hovers above him, holding his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu? I'm here, baby. It's me. It's Julie. I love you. You're gonna be okay, baby, I promise - All at once he seems to be RECEDING from JULIE and the ot SINKING THROUGH the bottom of the stretcher, and BEYOND - floor of the ambulance! JULIE's voice grows weaker, more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, baby. I won't leave you... And then all trace of the ambulance is gone, and he's flo through some strange LIMBO, surrounded by the silhouettes SHROUDS, with the sound of BIRDS CALLING all around him.. An AWFUL MECHANICAL RATCHETING NOISE fills the soundtrack close - and when they reopen, he finds himself in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny ROLLER-COASTER CAR descends from dense clouds down an impossibly long and rickety METAL TRACK. The track lea vast black VOID... ...to a tiny ISLAND floating in the darkness...an island unlike a disembodied FIST. And, as the car draws closer, the fist begins to OPEN - t turning into a HAND, with a full-sized TOWN nestled in it town, CARNIVAL LIGHTS begin to glitter. MUSIC begins to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car - a one-passenger job with a CARTOON ANIMAL FACE stops with a lurch. STU steps out onto a fog-shrouded TRA PLATFORM. Before he knows it, the little car DEPARTS behi stranded - alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anybody? - Am I dead? (beat) PLEASE. I'D LIKE TO KNOW IF I'M DEAD. Off in the fog is a big wheeled CART with the sign: "PSYC BAGGAGE CLAIM." There STU finds two SUITCASES and a BACKP examines the TAGS. They all belong to him! He sits on the edge of the cart, opens a SUITCASE, and pu - A bagged copy of Marvel Comics' Conan the Barbarian #1; - An 8mm reel of highlights from Ray Harryhausen's Jason Argonauts, with swordfighting skeletons on the box cover; - A SPIRAL NOTEBOOK, its cover labelled "STU M. - GEOGRAP inside pages covered with drawings of dinosaurs and airpl - Transparent plastic models of "THE VISIBLE MAN" and his VISIBLE WOMAN," with a couple of spare organs that young quite found a place for; - A vinyl LP of "BREAD'S GREATEST HITS," which STU quickl into the suitcase lest anyone see it. As he gathers his bags, he hears odd SQUEAKS and CHITTERI RACCOON (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry your bags, mister? A STRANGE FURRY CREATURE pops out from beneath the platfo STU's pants leg. It looks like a raccoon, but it's FLAT - pelt. Before STU has time to let out a yell, a FLAT SNAKE slithering out from beneath the baggage cart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigars, mister? Genuine Coobans! STU looks down and sees a SQUASHED RABBIT humping his leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna meet my sister? These bordertown types are known as ROADKILL, and they're tire tracks to prove it. STU SCREAMS, shakes them off, an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long stone STAIRWAY leads to decorative wrought-iron GA CARVED SPHINXES sit on either side. As STU races up the s sputtering NEON SIGN comes to life overhead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FANFARE BLOWS as the creaky gates begin to part. A SPOT SPHINXES - and they COME TO LIFE! They rise up on their h on boater hats. One of them blows a note on a kazoo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeee...welcome you to Dark Town And while you're in your coma This odd amusement park-town Will be your Home Sweet Homa - STU bolts THROUGH THE GATES, with the ROADKILL TRIO right The indignant SPHINXES exchange a look of outrage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a carny town, a tourist trap, seedy and nightmarish. festive trappings, there's something off about it - an ai and decrepitude - as if they'd tried to turn Alcatraz int and given up halfway through. STU looks back and sees the ROADKILL gaining on him. He s group of OTHER HUMANS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. Please. There's animals. They - The humans just YAWN. They're COMA VICTIMS, just like STU one of his SUITCASES as the ROADKILL come after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pony ride, Mister? He turns and spots a helpful-looking fellow in a COWBOY O COWBOY is in fact a CENTAUR - rider and mount rolled into The characters who run this place - the BARKERS, TICKET-T OPERATORS - are all weird HYBRIDS, part human, part ANIMA be the ancient Gods of some primitive culture - reduced t street entertainers in this ramshackle resort town. STU pinballs down the street, bouncing from one shock to - JOE CAMEL, doing community service as a STREET SWEEPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mister. Mister! Got a smoke? - a YETI selling SNO-CONES from a cart outside the MORPHE The marquee reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First-Run - Continuous Performances - Popular Prices Rated NR-H - Not Recommended for Humans - A CYCLOPS working as a barker at the Penny Arcade; - A VIDEO RENTAL OUTLET - "BAD DREAMS VIDEO," offering yo nightmares, cult and classic, three nights for $2.95. A T DEVIL emerges from the shop carrying a sackful of videos recognizes STU, much to his horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, aren't you Stu Miley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're big fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we have your autograph? Reduced to babbling hysteria, STU ducks into the nearest the door, an ANIMATED NEON SIGN shows a happy boozer lift glass, then falling over flat on his back, at which point replaced by the traditional cartoon X's. This is the COMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU bursts in, flattens himself against the wall as the R past outside. He's given them the slip. He looks around. The bar's a weird melange of styles. COMA VICTIMS ride ar wheelchairs refurbished as BUMPER CARS, drinking cocktail bottler. A four-armed ELEPHANT GOD is at the Mighty Wurli MERMAID VOCALIST in a half-shell belts out the wistful ly Mercer's "DREAM." And over at the BAR... BULL (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New in town, huh? What're you drinking? Out of breath, STU edges toward the bar as the BARTENDER, away to grab a fresh glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chasing me - animals - horrible -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animals? What kind of animals? STU GAGS. BULL is a full-fledged MINOTAUR, body of a man, BULL. His features are CUBIST - weirdly squashed over to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know - Picasso. Guernica, right? That's what everybody says - although personally, I don't see the resemblance. What are you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh - martini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive or eyeball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive. - Where exactly am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark Town. Land of nightmares. I'm Bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu Miley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've seen a few of your dreams. You're quite a celebrity down here. STU gives him a cockeyed look. BULL points to a MONITOR m bar, on which a panicked man in pajamas is trying to run through a great sticky SEA OF MOLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, it's the land of nightmares. Same on every channel...all the stuff people dream, after they have the extra anchovies. He changes channels with a remote. Now we see a guy falli midair, arms and legs flailing, falling, falling, falling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, it all looks like bad late-night cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sad commentary, huh? Now a small muffled VOICE speaks from the area of STU'S B DISEMBODIED VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Bull," huh? That's cute. What's your last name - "Shit"??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning angrily to STU) I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything. VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice face. Lemme guess. You were in a bullfight ...with a Mack Truck!! STU claps both hands over his mouth to prove he's not the BULL glowers at him, snorting STEAM out of both nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was, uh, just getting ready to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Jumbo. We got us some kind of ventriloquist here. The ELEPHANT GOD from the Wurlitzer organ comes lumbering VOICE (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kiddin', folks! Drinks for everybody - (pointing at STU) On him!! HIYA, BOSS!! BULL and JUMBO back off, STUNNED. The monkey grabs STU'S a big wet SMOOCH right on his NOSE. STU SCREAMS.

dialogues.text: TIGHT ON an EEG monitor. There's a sudden BLIP on the rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor too. I know this man's brain - JULIE strokes STU's limp hand. He's COMATOSE, cocooned in wires and tubes. His head and shoulders are heavily banda hooked up to as much machinery as you can cram into one r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Doctor. Rest. Come back when you can do us some good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead on her feet, JULIE stumbles toward the exit. As she' passes the WAITING ROOM -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

And behind It appears that almost everyone in the waiting room is a and STU's. Disheveled and groggy, they rouse themselves a way over to JULIE's side. She's overcome with emotion. INT. STU & JULIE'S HOUSE - ENTRY - NIGHT The sound of the key in the lock is met by INSANE BARKING ALICE enter and are met by BUSTER, the pet basset - jumpi like crazy after 24 hours without food or human company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't pick a fight. I'm staying over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, poor Buster. He hasn't been fed in a day and a half. Let me get some food... ALICE kneels to play with the dog. She hears a sudden GAS kitchen. JULIE is standing by the open refrigerator, wear absolutely stricken expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALICE finds JULIE holding a bottle of champagne - Veuve C Grande Dame 1989 - all wrapped up in a bow and ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess it was... She bursts into tears. ALICE sits her down at the kitchen takes the champagne from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all poignant. We're keeping this bottle on ice. When he comes around you're going to need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limp JULIE soaking in a steamy tub, one arm dangling ov the vanity is a framed PHOTO STRIP, four poses for a doll first three, STU and JULIE are making outrageously goony fourth, they imitate the stern-faced farm couple from Ame She gazes at it for a long, long time. Eventually she smi

dialogues.text: OPEN on two PHOTOS, mounted in a single frame. On the lef KEATON, droopy-eyed, in his familiar porkpie hat and vest a Photoshopped image of BUSTER THE BASSETT HOUND, in the wearing Keaton's hat and vest. These photos are on the wall of the cramped room which se studio and JULIE's office. MONKEYBONE STRIPS are scattere drafting table. ALICE is making up the sofa as a guest be As she's hanging her coat in the closet she comes across CANVAS in the back, stashed behind a battered portfolio a of spiral-bound sketchbooks. She pulls it out. She's obvi by it, but she can't tear her eyes away... She's still gaping at the painting when JULIE enters in a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu. That was right about the time we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he first came in to the sleep lab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...before your time. The canvas depicts a group of SURGEONS with the faces of standing over a HUMAN PATIENT, replacing his internal org MACHINE PARTS. The style is at once cartoony and unsettli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, honey...he always joked about you curing him, but I never realized what you cured him from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hadn't gotten a good night's sleep in years. The nightmares would wake him up, and he'd start right in painting... (chuckling) That boy looked like pluperfect hell. ALICE's gaze goes from the nightmare paintings to the MON tacked up over the drafting table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you get from here - to there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. It was bicameral disjunction - right brain and left brain out of balance. He was a rightie, so I made him switch the pencil to his left hand. Just to see what'd come out. A smile comes to JULIE's face. She settles in on the floo and digs through the various portfolios until she comes u quickie CARTOON on the back of a napkin - the prototype f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkeybone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left-handed, he was funny. He'd been doing all this scary, intense work...then he found out he could draw this stuff, and make me laugh, and he liked that. (shrugging) And then the nightmares just...stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow - two guys in the same brain. - Which one did you fall in love with? JULIE smiles at the cartoon. She isn't telling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've put a ton of work into that boy, Alice. I am not going to let him get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE, in her white lab coat, wanders through Intensive C WOMAN hunched over STU's bed, BAWLING HER EYES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimmy...? KIMMY looks up. She's crying so much she can barely recog

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Julie...my poor Stu...my poor baby brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When'd you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour ago. (gathering herself) I tried to prepare myself, but I didn't know he would be like, like this. I can't even bear to look at him... How about you? You're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Kimmy. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had so much I always wanted to say to him. At least he had a chance to give you the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandmama's ring. The engagement ring. He asked me to send it to him - JULIE turns to look at STU in the bed. The certain knowle about to propose is like a knife in her heart. KIMMY feel having let the cat out of the bag, but before they can ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brewster? Julie? I'm Dr. Edelstein. Cheery DR. EDELSTEIN enters. He shakes hands with the wom STU's readouts, making notations on his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vital signs have stabilized. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give us a realistic sense of my brother's chances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's held on this far. We can't do much but wait and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But these...machines are what's keeping him alive, is that right? This remark sends a shiver down JULIE's spine, but she ke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the moment, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a realistic idea...of how long this is going to last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comas are unpredictable. He could wake up today, tomorrow, a month from now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I have to clarify this. The thing is, Dr. Edelstein, my brother has an absolute horror of doctors - hospitals - needles - all of it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimmy, he doesn't know what's going on. He doesn't even know he's in a -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Julie. This is not easy for me. Our father took a long time to die. A long time. It just about killed us all. And Stu and I made a pact that when our time came - we wouldn't let it drag out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too soon even to - talk about that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a date, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months. (pause) There's always some brain damage. But at three months...the chances of coming back shrink dramatically with every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to have every chance, Doctor. We can certainly give it...three months. No one says anything. But both women look at STU, and the other, and everyone knows exactly where everyone else sta a sinking feeling that STU is working on a 3-month deadli

dialogues.text: A beauty pageant - shapely INGENUES in EVENING GOWNS bein an EMCEE with enormous teeth.

dialogues.text: And now George will give us his analysis of Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle as it pertains to third-world economics!! CAMERA PULLS BACK - and we realize we're in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I'm gonna wash that man right outta my hair! In fact he goes into a little softshoe, keeping the brief over his crotch. Unfortunately, THE CASE POPS OPEN, dumpi LINGERIE all over the stage. The weeping GEORGE must craw fours to retrieve it... By now the onlookers at the bar are CRACKING UP. All exce lonely, disconsolate fellow on the last stool, nursing a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stu, why so glum? Everybody loves a good humiliation nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months, Bull. Three months tonight. Three months since the accident - and I'm no closer to going home than I was then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, buck up. Have another 'tini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick of martinis. I'm sick of the waiting, and the carnival rides, and watching people's nightmares. And of course, I need not add - He GRIMACES at MONKEYBONE, who's stretched out atop the m at the other end of the room. The MERMAID CHANTEUSE is si Dietrich number, "The Laziest Gal in Town" - or at least because MONKEYBONE is caterwauling behind her. By the tim the grand finale, he's practically BAYING AT THE MOON. Pissed off, she SHAKES her FIST at MONKEYBONE and pulls t clamshell SHUT. This suits MONKEYBONE just fine, as it le in the spotlight to soak up what little applause there is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you for that very modest response. I know you're all in comas, but still. And now...it's dedication time! He gestures to JUMBO, the elephant organist, who begins t

dialogues.text: We've got a special dedication tonight. This one's from my ever-lovin' boss, Mr. Stu Mopey - I mean Miley - and we're sendin' it up to a very special lady in the land of the living. Yes, I do mean Julie - the beautiful Miss Julie - who, if she has a brain in her head, is shacked up right now with some good-lookin' doc she met in the E.R.! (pointing at STU) JUST KIDDING, BUDDY! Because if we know anything about Miss Julie, we know she is faithful, loyal, and true. Even if her boyfriend is an eggplant. Which is why we're dedicating...this very special tune...to her. Jumbo? JUMBO's tasteful vamping gives way to a RAUNCHY ROCK BEAT MONKEYBONE begins STRUTTING across the top of the piano, grinding and shaking his booty to the tune of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAH baby does the Hanky-Panky! UNHH! MAH baby does the Hanky-Panky! UNHH! MONKEYBONE sings the same poignant line over and over unt storming over from the bar and YANKS HIM off the Wurlitze of his scrawny NECK. A trouper to the end, MONKEYBONE WAVES at the crowd even him off to an empty table in the farthest corner of the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have humiliated me in public for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that. Besides, I can't help myself. I'm just a figment of your imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you can learn to act normally. I had to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, come on. You know you love me. You're a masochistic pain freak. You gotta love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not. And I don't gotta. MONKEYBONE waves and winks at every female who passes by. upside the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are too! Mooning over Julie when we could both be gettin' some o' this fine local action. It's not like she's gonna know. Out of town, under five minutes, and in a coma don't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. The women here aren't my type. Most of them aren't even my species. Cocktail waitress KITTY, a seven-foot cat-faced feline se in her skimpy black dress and shows STU a Cheshire-cat gr reclines, Odalisque-style, on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooooooooo, Kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Stu. Refill on that martini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like something with an umbrella in it and a really smutty name. Like a...Sex Behind the Sofa with Your Parents in the Same Room Watching "The Brady Bunch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing for him! He's being repressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong, Stu? You seem so tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah, it's the same as always...poor mope's just wishin' he was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to get through to the head guy - the nightmare god - what's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypnos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. To see if he could expedite my case. But I wait, and I wait, and...I'm starting to think I'll never see her again. A softie at heart, KITTY sits across from STU and takes h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shoulda proposed, Kitty. That way at least she'd know how I feel. That way she'd...wait for me. She leans forward sympathetically. From this particular v MONKEYBONE has an unobstructed view of KITTY's cleavage. - although he's not quite as obvious about staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is waiting for you, Stu. I know she is. Guys like you don't come along that often. Believe me, I know. MONKEYBONE slinks over behind STU - up onto his shoulder into his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Fellow Americans. I have a dream. Let us boldly go where no man has gone before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

KITTY is holding the cleavage pose for an unnaturally lon furry tail begins to swing back and forth playfully in th hypnotic - like a windshield wiper. STU stares at it. MONKEYBONE stares at it. And MONKEYBONE responds by straightening...stiffening...bending upward s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, pal! It was a compliment! You'da done the same if you had the equipment!

dialogues.speaker: FORGET IT
dialogues.text: STU LUNGES at MONKEYBONE - who JUMPS OVER HIM, BOUNDS off the table, and grabs hold of a CHANDELIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm reportin' this to my union!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What union?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: - and DIVES - directly between KITTY's breasts into her s dress!! STU circles around KITTY, following the undulatin BLOB that's tunnelling around under her dress. Finally MO out of the BACK of the dress and NUZZLES KITTY'S EAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left my phone number in your undies. Try not to lose it in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kitty! I'll be right back after I choke my monkey. MONKEYBONE runs under the pool table. STU is giving chase suddenly - a DOOR blows open in the chill night wind. EVERYONE IN THE BAR freezes in place. For there, in the doorway, is a looming, ominous figure - dreaded figure in all of Dark Town - - a GRIM REAPER, nine feet tall and swinging a scythe, co hapless coma victim to the land of Death! EERIE WINDS WHISTLE and the shroud FLUTTERS in the night REAPER looks from face to face. For a moment he focuses o backs away involuntarily, with a mounting sense of dread. MONKEYBONE jumps into his arms, clinging to him fearfully But the REAPER moves on - past each COMA VICTIM in turn - STOPPING in front of a TINY, WIZENED, PRUNELIKE OLD GENT wheelchair, who looks to be 110 years old at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him. Whew. About time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hear you, young fellow. Speak up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EARL BIEGLER, I'VE COME TO GIVE YOU - aw, hell. Here. GASPS OF ANTICIPATION all around the room as the REAPER h long white ENVELOPE. EARL opens it slowly and removes... ...an oversized rectangular TICKET...the size of a Hershe SOLID GOLD, with the letter "E" stamped upon it. VARIOUS CHARACTERS around the barroom react, in hushed vo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got a reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for him! He's gonna wake up! EARL throws his crutches aside, jumps out of his chair, a JIG, waving the ticket over his head. STU stares at him w

dialogues.text: No. No. Not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, suckers! See you in the funny papers! EARL does an end-zone dance toward the door. One by one, get up from their seats to watch EARL's departure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COMA VICTIMS shuffle toward a BIG RIDE across the mid It's a "TEST YOUR STRENGTH" machine - the kind where you mallet and try to ring the bell. It's surrounded by croco storm fences and electrified barbed wire, and a big sign - NO ADMITTANCE. EARL, still jubilant, inserts his E-ticket into a recepta entrance. A DRAWBRIDGE LOWERS, and CAROUSEL MUSIC cranks CARNIVAL LIGHTS blink on, and FIREWORKS rocket into the s All around them, faces turn skyward. CLOUDS are parting. swirling colors is forming DIRECTLY ABOVE the E-ticket ri PINPOINT HOLE opens up at its center. The "TEST YOUR STRENGTH" machine has been outfitted with the bell-ringer should be. Once EARL has settled in, a GI MAN lifts its enormous mallet... ...and SLAMS IT DOWN on the lever end of the machine, sen ROCKETING UPWARD toward the hole in the sky. DING!! The S BELL, but EARL keeps going - up - up - UP... Then, with a distinct POP, he's gone. Over the rainbow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ninety. He's practically dead already. How come he goes back and I stay here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he wanted to pick out his own casket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning abruptly)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: STU marches across the street to the GRIM REAPER - who's his WINGED BICYCLE and seems shocked that anyone would wa him. MONKEYBONE scurries alongside, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got an E-ticket. Where's mine? When do I get to wake up??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu? Stu? Let's not disturb the nice Reaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been stuck down here for months. Somebody had better start paying attention, or I'm gonna - I'm gonna kick ass!

When the end of the finger, it TAKES OFF into the void and KEEPS O

dialogues.text: STU'S EYES widen with excitement as the MESSENGER scoots

dialogues.text: Hypnos! The god of nightmares! Do you know what this means, Monkeybone? He's finally going to hear my case. I'm going home!

dialogues.text: Like you'd know. You started out on the back of a napkin, you little...doodle. Scowling at each other, the boys turn their backs and par follow MONKEYBONE to the wet bar, where he almost immedia a statuesque GORGON with a full head of writhing SNAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, big boy. He grins and shrugs: what the hell. As they head for a ba BARTENDER hands him a SNAKEBITE KIT. A look of apprehension crosses MONKEYBONE's face. But bef change his mind, the GORGON'S HAND yanks him out of frame STU, meanwhile, is crossing the dance floor, moving among animal-people who DANCE in their bizarre, uninhibited way WOMAN - the bottom half of her body a big human HAND - SM he passes. He tries to talk to her, but she's dancing, an constantly moving legs it's difficult to get in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, have you seen Mr. Hypnos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyp? He was here a while ago. Aren't you Stu Miley? The nightmare guy? STU grins meekly, nods yes. She pulls him over to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you were going to be here tonight. This is so cool! JUMBO the ELEPHANT GOD is dancing in ungainly fashion nea swings out and hits one of the HAND WOMAN'S arms - which marble statuary. Before she can let out a squeal, he does she's armless - a regular Venus de Milo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fat slob! Watch what you're doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you slap me? Go on, slap me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Stu. Let's go where the real fun is. She leads him over to the sunken living room. Among the o see a CYCLOPS, a YETI, a BBQ PIG. A number of sofas and l are arranged around a big crystal ORB in the center of th The ORB is where nightmares happen. Although the perspect the locales change abruptly, as in a movie, all the night 3-D quality - as if they're taking place right here in th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Live feed, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Hyp gets all the best stuff before it goes out to the theatres. STU grins in anticipation. He finds an empty chair and st down - but there's a SLUG with a MAN'S HEAD already in it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. STU picks another seat. The HAND WOMAN sidles up alongsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! There's a new one just starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In long shot we see a handsome young couple dressed in pa Emerging from a sylvan glade, they kiss in golden sunligh breaks free - sprints through knee-high sunflowers to the field, where a picnic blanket is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: HIS FACE GOES PALE as he recognizes the man in the paisle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That - that's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shirt, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paisley-shirted STU pours champagne for two. Toasts his b is, of course, JULIE, the dreamer of the dream. He pulls out a little velvet RING BOX and offers it to he tries to take it, he pulls it away, teasing her, and STEA Suddenly the two of them are locked in a tight embrace, r through the flowers, LAUGHING, full of joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DARKTOWNERS are rubbing their hands together in antic horrors to come. STU looks from one misshapen face to the heart pounding with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Who's dreaming this?? (beat) Julie??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, keep it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE rolls onto her back on the grass, FACE AGLOW. Only that STU IS NO LONGER THERE BESIDE HER. She looks around. Gets to her feet. Turns. And the BACKGR MORPHS suddenly into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is decorated for a FAREWELL PARTY, complete with confetti. KIMMY, DR. EDELSTEIN, various MEDICAL PERSONNEL are wearing party hats, lifting champagne glasses in a to guest of honor...the comatose Stu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DARKTOWNERS clustered around the orb can barely conce excitement. It's obvious that the nightmares they're watc than mere entertainment - they get some kind of addictive charge from the spectacle of human terror.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: He tries to push his way forward to the orb. An angry CYC aside. A YETI grabs his coat and pushes him out of the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu!! What are you doing? Chill out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMATOSE STU stands in the center of the room, UPRIGHT an party hat. A weird UMBILICAL CORD extends from his navel groaning BELLOWS DEVICE - like an artificial lung, it's a him breathing. EDELSTEIN hands a pair of OVERSIZED CEREMONIAL SCISSORS t she CUTS THE CORD, as if opening a new mall. Applause all races toward STU in slo-mo, SHRIEKING - - as he DEFLATES into a LIMP PUDDLE OF FLESH before her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. STU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE's distress is killing him. Yet all around him, DARK cackling their heads off, growling, howling, punching the air like rowdy drunks at a football game. He LOSES IT ALT

dialogues.speaker: PLUG
dialogues.text: He won't be stopped this time. He makes for the orb - cli sofas, pushing guests aside, knocking over their drinks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY! Watch it, you stinkin' gringo -

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Somehow, JULIE has heard him!! Down in the nightmare orb, is looking UP, trying to locate the source of STU's disem He struggles to reach the orb, but the CYCLOPS is holding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu? STU...? STU breaks free and FLINGS HIMSELF on the ORB - which SHO haze of smoke and sparks, abruptly ending the nightmare. vanishes - and STU gropes at the air, DESPAIRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real JULIE awakens suddenly and lets out a scream of

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Only now does she realize where she is. She's fallen asle visitor's chair next to STU's bed. The clock on the wall STU'S READOUTS are spiking like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU is being dragged across the dance floor by the YETI a ELEPHANT GOD. HAND WOMAN brings up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who invited this schmuck, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's my fault. I thought he was cooler than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Please. It's my girlfriend. I've gotta get a message to her... But just then a hush falls over the room, and someone scr

dialogues.speaker: HYP
dialogues.text: A WALL PANEL does a 180-degree turn, and a CIRCULAR BED r room. Languishing atop it, garbed in a silk robe which ex the black & white checkerboard pattern of the bedspre ...is a CHUBBY, GRINNING, SLEEPY-EYED SATYR, with horns a WASP WOMEN are with him on the bed, brushing his furry go feeding him grapes. As STU fights his way over, he sees an odd LUMP wriggling bedcovers. Out pops MONKEYBONE, clutching a bottle of cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I left it in there somewhere. He shakes the bottle, pops the cork, and SPRAYS SPURTING HYPNOS, the GIRLS, and everyone else within firing range!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haw! I like a monkey with vision!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it, partner! Hilarity all around. STU snatches MONKEYBONE off the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu... It's a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hypnos - sir - I needed to talk to you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Stu Miley, right? Boys and girls ...Mr. Stu Miley, in the house! (leading a round of applause) This is an honor. We see a lot of nightmares down here, but yours are like caviar, man. You da shits!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hypnos, I saw a dream. My girlfriend was having it. She dreamed they were pulling the plug on me. She was watching me die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have to get a message to her. I have to let her know I'm okay. Until I can get out of here... A vaguely embarrassed look crosses HYPNOS's face. All the DARKTOWNERS stare at their shoes, clear their throats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which is actually what I wanted to talk to you about. See, I've been here three months - With a brusque gesture, HYPNOS sends the party girls pack one arm around STU's shoulder and pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid - didn't they tell you about this party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a special kind of party. A farewell party. Do you...get what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farewell? You mean - you mean I'm - STU EXPLODES WITH JOY. He practically dances a jig.

dialogues.speaker: I'M OUTTA HERE. I...
dialogues.text: One by one, the celebrants turn their backs and slink dis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I...I'm about to... Am I mistaken, or don't I get to... Is there some...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'see, Stu, as I understand it, you made this pact with your sister...no life support? MONKEYBONE's jaw drops. He slaps himself across the foreh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pact? Pact? NO LIFE SUPPORT??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - yeah - but that doesn't...apply. It was different then. I was depressed. My life is great now. I'm in love! MONKEYBONE marches back and forth across the bed, wearing expression as he MOCKS STU in a singsongy voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the plug! Pull the plug! Take my organs! I don't need 'em! I don't need no! Life support! I'm an idiot! Pull the pl-- STU grabs the monkey and clamps a hand over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, Julie wouldn't...she'd never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Stu, Julie doesn't get to decide. That's why she was having the nightmare. (an embarrassed shrug) They're pulling the plug at nine AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine AM! But that's - twelve hours. In checking his watch, STU removes his hand from MONKEYBO singsong resumes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so dumb! I deserve to die -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hypnos, you run this place. I'm begging you. There's gotta be something I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, I like you personally, I admire your work, but I'm just the God of Sleep. This is Death's bailiwick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could talk to Death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Me, go crawling to Death? My friend, it will be a cold, cold day in Las Vegas, Nevada, before I go crawling to that piece of - HYP shuts up. Looks around the room, as if he's afraid of overheard. Then he gestures to the boys to join him on th They climb aboard eagerly. HYPNOS hits his remote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and they rotate AWAY from the party. Privacy at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Death is not what you would call a people person, like me. Death is a putz - and I should know. I'm his little brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Death's brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Mr. By-the-book, Stick-Up-the-Ass, My- Way-or-the-Highway Death. Believe me - over the course of eternity, you get pretty damned tired of that schtick. (spreading his hands) So I need a job. He sticks me in this broke-down amusement park, with a buncha animals to run it. I'm supposed to be grateful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penthouse is pretty swank, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I decorated it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I don't mean to be rude, but I only have eleven hours and fifty-three minutes to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Cheating Death. There's one thing you might try. Only one guy in history ever pulled it off. Well, actually two. Actually, no, there was that other guy who...well, very few people have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyp, I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. And I mean anything. Ask the chicks in the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen those E-tickets, right? Well, what you gotta do...is go into the Land of Death... and steal an E-ticket right out from under Death's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Land of Death. How do I get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, listen: that's all I'm saying. And you didn't hear it from me. HYP hits the remote. The bed begins to ROTATE OUTWARD aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard of a fate worse than Death? That's what's waiting for you if you screw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HYP gives the boys a wink and a thumbs-up, then wanders o his other guests. MONKEYBONE shakes STU's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fate worse than death! Well, it's been real, boss, but I gotta go buff up my resum. ANYBODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! Don't put yourself out. I'll go to the land of Death alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, you have my absolute confidence. - DEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing him by the throat) I've got one chance to get back to Julie, and I'm gonna take it - with or without you. He turns and stalks off. MONKEYBONE stands there blinking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Aren't you gonna talk me into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Goodbye. Thanks for nothing. Stunned, MONKEYBONE scurries along behind him, PLEADING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta talk me into it. You'll screw up on your own. I mean, a guy's gotta have a sidekick. For moral support! Wisecracks - snappy banter - (wrapping himself around STU's leg) It's the land of Death, Stu, the Land of Death! Don't go in there without your comedy relief!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. You can come.

dialogues.speaker: OH, THANK YOU
dialogues.text: (suddenly realizing) Something went very, very wrong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we just gotta figure out how to get there. As if in reply, a PALE, SPECTRAL PRESENCE comes drifting dance floor - an eight-foot-tall GRIM REAPER. The boys duck behind a POTTED PLANT to watch as he zeroes BAR - where a beautiful coma victim, LULU, is drunkenly m another sloshed corpse-to-be, FRED.

dialogues.speaker: LULU LA RUE. I HAVE COME FOR YOU.
dialogues.text: LULU doesn't notice. She continues grappling with FRED. M REAPER dives in and tries to disentangle them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shay, you're kinda cute. She ditches FRED and throws her arms around the REAPER. R pushes her away, props her against the nearest wall - - and TOUCHES HER with one bony finger above the heart! I throwing a switch. Her body stiffens. Her EYES cross. Her out of her mouth. She makes a noise like a DIAL TONE. The true horror of death is that it makes you look like a The REAPER pulls a collapsible HAND TRUCK from beneath hi starts maneuvering LULU onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say there. How 'bout one for the road? The REAPER ignores him. FRED holds up a cocktail glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this for me, pally. The REAPER heaves a sigh and takes the cocktail glass. FR pitcher filled with some luminescent tropical concoction. ...and POURS IT down the REAPER's front!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooopsy daisy.

dialogues.speaker: ON STU AND MONKEYBONE
dialogues.text: WINCING at the REAPER in his sopping wet, pink-stained sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they call "death with dignity"? The REAPER wrings out his shroud and grabs the hand truck LULU past the boys, MONKEYBONE pops up with a helpful hin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words for you, my friend: club soda. STU claps a hand over MB's mouth as the REAPER turns down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The still-muttering REAPER wheels LULU toward the entranc The boys are skulking along behind him at a discreet dist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking her to the land of Death, right? So all we've gotta do is...hitch a ride! (beat) Stop shaking! I'll protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Mr. Action Hero! Why couldn't I be Arnold Schwarzenegger's figment? The REAPER approaches the GATES. He presses a remote-cont the meshing teeth of the gates slide back far enough to l through. STU realizes they've only got an instant to make their mo through the gates at top speed. As soon as he's on the ot hears a nasty CLANG behind him... MONKEYBONE is caught - his body contorted like a pretzel, out among the meshing teeth! STU gives him a good hard YA slips out like a strand of fettuccine. They hear RUMBLING on the tracks outside. A CAR is arrivi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAPER loads LULU into the little roller-coaster and The car begins to move. STU and MONKEYBONE get there just jump onto the LUGGAGE RACK in the back!

dialogues.speaker: ON ROLLER-COASTER
dialogues.text: They peep over the back of the car at the REAPER and wond next. MONKEYBONE spies a TOOL KIT mounted under the rack pulls out a big, nasty MONKEYWRENCH. The boys nod in agreement. MONKEYBONE clambers over the b and hoists the wrench. STU covers his eyes. WHANG! STU looks up - sees a confused MONKEYBONE alone in the ca Now he clambers into the car as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There's no trace of the REAPER - except for a rumpled shr wristwatch, and a St. Christopher's medal on the floor of boys exchange a puzzled shrug. MONKEYBONE tries on the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall clock says it's not quite 3 AM, yet JULIE has ma up all her co-workers: ALICE, HUTCH, CLARISSA, et al. The disheveled, un-made-up, unshaven. But they're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hours. That's when they pull the plug. That's how long we've got to wake him up. (beat) Now these are Stu's old charts from five years ago, when he first came to the sleep lab... She points to a series of EASELS where HUTCH and ALICE ha up EEG printouts, engram maps, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they show incredibly intense nightmare activity. The chart below is his new chart... The lower chart shows a JAGGED SPIKE virtually identical the upper chart. JULIE pauses for effect - then pulls on lower chart, OPENING IT UP like a gatefold - The onlookers GASP. Opened accordion-style, the lower cha SAME SPIKE recurring again and again, TEN TIMES OVER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stuck in a loop - a nightmare loop. (beat) Anybody here know what Oneirix is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure - it's an enzyme. The brain secretes it during violent dream activity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nightmare juice. Julie and I were on the team that learned to synthesize it. If those charts are right, Stu's swimming in the stuff. (puzzled) Are you thinking we can decrease the levels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to give him more. I want to give him a massive dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to stop his nightmare -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to stop the nightmare, Hutch. I want to crank it up. I want to take it right off the charts. I want to scare him awake. The group exchanges nervous glances: it's risky. JULIE cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! We have a plan. Let's move! As the group swings into action, HUTCH pulls JULIE aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Julie, even if this works - which it probably won't - that stuff is tricky. You don't know what it'll do to his brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it do if they pull the plug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PANORAMIC VIEW of an impossibly grand, Gilded-Age TRAIN central turntable is the hub for dozens of TUNNELS, which the spokes of a wheel, disgorging long trains full of DEA from all over the world. Far above, in the dizzying reaches of the vaulted DOME th station, REAPERS on FLYING BICYCLES spiral about like mos bringing dead souls to their final reward. This is Thanatopolis - land of Death - truly the end of t A WET SQUEEGEE scrapes across the frame - wielded by a GR jumpsuit bearing the logo of "LAND OF DEATH WINDOW WASHER noise is irritating, so a REAPER on the inside snaps the shut, cutting off our view. CAMERA PULLS BACK, and we realize we've been seeing all t wall-to-wall windows of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like the observation bridge in the nose of the N decor is ornate, and the office equipment - vacuum tubes, intercoms, etc. - is on loan from the Jules Verne Museum Technology. REAPERS are bustling about everywhere. One of them pushin laden with oversized crates bearing the label "DEAD SOULS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Batch of souls - just back from Processing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them over there with the others. He unloads the crates in a corner of the room, where SCOR souls are already piled up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Grimness? We have a new shipment - DEATH (o.s.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... I'll get to it... We can't see DEATH himself - just the back of a tall swiv much creaking, it rotates around - bringing us face-to-fa

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: He's not at all what you'd expect. He's a chubby-cheeked, ACCOUNTANT TYPE...a harried bureaucrat, just trying to do There's something sweet, almost avuncular about him. There's an open crate of DEAD SOULS on his desk. Dead sou form of PERFORATED PAPER DOLLS...two-dimensional, underwe usually wearing expressions of shock. DEATH pulls a sheet detaches the dead soul, and outfits it with a cut-out TOG Now he places it in a big diorama - with OODLES of toga-c staring up at a scale model of an active volcano. He thro BEAMS as the volcano spits BLOBS OF KETCHUP into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last Days of Pompeii...now there was a Great Moment in Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may point out...it is 12:05... DEATH, grumbling, digs into the box and pulls out another light up. He clutches the sheet with trembling hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe - oh, man, I - SINATRA!! Do you know how long I've been waiting for this? Sure enough, the doll on the sheet is Ol' Blue Eyes. DEAT desk drawer and pulls out a SHOEBOX DIORAMA...DINO and SA microphones, with a third, center mike conspicuously open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that 12:07, your bleakness...the dispatch team is waiting... Grumpy, DEATH shoves FRANK, DEAN, and SAMMY back in the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, send 'em in. Jeez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLUNKY opens the office door, and a long line of REAPER DEATH lugs an enormous musty leather-bound BOOK over to a snaps his fingers and WHISTLES. His pet HELLHOUND - a tiny plump weiner dog, with a HORNE for a face, comes skittering across the office floor and lap. Meanwhile, the ASSISTANT turns on a chugging, card-s COMPUTER, which spits out a length of TICKERTAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chakasandra Singh, New Delhi. Snakebite. DEATH checks the name against the master list in his big pulls out a document and puts his STAMP on it - the DEATH he gives to the REAPER at the head of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mulrooney, Lavinia P., Dearborn, Michigan. Head crushed in a pants press. As the line moves along, we notice an odd-looking REAPER desk. His gait is wobbly. His head bobs independently of body. There's a big, luminescent STAIN on the front of hi

dialogues.speaker: YOU
dialogues.text: EVERYONE FREEZES as DEATH points a bony finger DIRECTLY A REAPER with the iridescent stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the customer, okay? You're about to die. It's a big occasion. A formal occasion. And as you shuffle off this mortal coil, the last thing your eyes behold is a Grim Reaper covered with... (sputtering) What the hell is that?? TWO VOICES come out from under the shroud at once:

dialogues.speaker: STU MONKEYBONE
dialogues.text: Cranberry Margarita.                Sex on the Beach. Much COUGHING and THROAT-CLEARING from under the shroud. LAPDOG is GROWLING at the STAINED REAPER, and DEATH can't anyone is saying. He shushes the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What??

dialogues.speaker: STU MONKEYBONE
dialogues.text: Salty Dog.                          Sufferin' Bastard. The little hellhound YIPS VICIOUSLY. DEATH whacks him on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - whatever it is - you get that shroud to the dry cleaner ASAP! Now where were we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarke P. Devereaux, San Francisco. Complications resulting from coma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait. Says here he's supposed to recover. A loud chorus of "A WWWWW's" from the disappointed REAPER the word "REPRIEVE" on Clarke's warrant. His ASSISTANT crosses the room. In the far wall is a stee VAULT DOOR with a hydraulic wheel - the kind you see at b ASSISTANT dials in a combination, turns the wheel, labori door open and STEPS INSIDE... ...returning, a moment later, with a priceless gold E-TIC The UPPER HALF of the STAINED REAPER begins to gyrate wil

dialogues.speaker: ON STU
dialogues.text: MONKEYBONE is doing an agitated TAP DANCE on his head. Hi repeatedly across STU'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAPER in front of the boys stares at the E-ticket, c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this to Dark Town. Sad to say, he's gonna live another forty years. (a consoling pat on the shoulder) Sorry. Nobody said this job would be easy. The ASSISTANT hands the REAPER a YELLOW MAILMAN'S POUCH c E-ticket. But before he can depart, the STAINED REAPER - MONKEYBONE - jumps to the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Then a m appears on either side of LULU's car, swarming out onto t starts pedaling for his life. He makes for the TRAIN TUNNELS in the far wall of the sta ILLUMINATED SIGNS over the tunnels read: Calcutta...Hong ...and directly ahead... Dark Town!! By now they're well out onto the turnaround. frantically, BOUNCING over tracks and ties. MONKEYBONE bi fingernails down to the quick as he watches the column of pursuing them onto the tracks.

DEATH has activated the TRAIN TURNAROUND - the rotating p end of the line which allows an engine to reverse directi know it, they're doing a full 180!

Trailing black fumes, the BICYCLE RIS converge in its path, and RAISE THEIR SCYTHES... But the bike JUST MANAGES TO CLEAR the tangle of scythes REAPERS slicing at empty air!

dialogues.text: Through the big window, he sees the boys leveling off, fl DARK TOWN TUNNEL. They're moments away from a clean escap

Just STU - who finds himself on an op with the world of the painting coming to 3-D life around FACED SURGEONS are closing in on him, baring their fangs, their scalpels and their metallic REPLACEMENT PARTS... Suddenly the fabric of this weird reality TEARS - just li canvas. A FURRY PAW reaches through - GRABS STU by the ha

dialogues.text: STU pedals so hard his heart is about to burst. He feels side - the yellow pouch containing the E-ticket is still REAPERS are clustered at the mouth of the tunnel, but the following. The boys WEEP WITH GLEE. It's a miracle - they've cheated

dialogues.text: An exhausted STU huffs and puffs as he pedals the bike up stretch of track to the platform outside the gates. He cl bike and stares back - it looks like the last thousand mi all been uphill. He slings the YELLOW POUCH over his shou

dialogues.text: You saved my life, Monkeybone. I never would've made it without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it. We got exactly five minutes left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...now that I'm leaving, I feel like there's lots of things I haven't said. Who's gonna look out for you? Are you gonna be okay when I'm gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't you worry. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been a hell of a figment, pal. I sure wish I could take you home with me. The gates slide open. STU passes through. But MONKEYBONE a moment - just long enough for one of the SINGING SPHINX a big, nasty BASEBALL BAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwww. Worried about my feelings, are you? Well, there's a new twist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't joke around, little buddy. I mean it. I really do love y-- He turns - and MONKEYBONE MARK McGWIRES HIM upside the he crumples in a heap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too. Boss. Laughing maniacally, MONKEYBONE STEALS the E-TICKET and g

dialogues.text: STU'S HEAD is swimming. It takes him a few seconds, but h feet. By now, MONKEYBONE is halfway to the E-ticket ride. STU'S WATCH reads 8:59 AM!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Monkeybone! Please!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STREETS ARE LINED with Darktowners ROOTING MONKEYBONE the hometown favorite in a big footrace. Which he is. MONKEYBONE reaches the E-TICKET RIDE - drops his E-TICKET receptacle at the gate. The drawbridge lowers... As STU sprints down the street, the SNAIL MAN oozes into TRIPS HIM! Before he can get up, cackling DARKTOWNERS con forcing him back to the ground and HOLDING HIM THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Stu. It's all part of the deal. We've got big plans for that body of yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar miasma of COLORS is beginning to swirl in th overhead. MONKEYBONE straps on a NEEDLE-TIPPED HELMET whi look like a simian DART. Then he climbs into the seat of STRENGTH machine and braces himself for the big ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONLOOKERS APPLAUD as the robot lifts its mallet and LETS tiny figure of MONKEYBONE soars toward the swirling color HELMET strikes the black hole dead center. STU WATCHES HELPLESSLY as MONKEYBONE penetrates the veil VANISHES. He's still SCREAMING when the cackling DARKTOWN out of the plaza by the heels...

dialogues.speaker: ON MONKEYBONE
dialogues.text: ROCKETING UPWARD through the clouds in his dart-helmet, a EXHILARATION on his simian face. Somewhere a CLOCK begins hour...

dialogues.text: MOST OF OUR CAST is either in STU's room or in the hallwa PLUS we've got a man of the cloth; two LEGAL TYPES, with several of the NURSES from the facility. ALICE squeezes JULIE's hand, and JULIE squeezes STU's. Th on the clock hits twelve. KIMMY, sobbing into a handkerch EDELSTEIN the nod. As he reaches for the power switch...

dialogues.text: JULIE DROPS the hand with a gasp. The DOCTOR jumps half a All at once STU is sitting BOLT UPRIGHT IN BED...shaking feeling around gingerly under the bedclothes, as if somet has just poked him in the ass.

dialogues.text: Oooie! That smarts!!! KIMMY sighs and FAINTS DEAD AWAY. STU blinks and looks about the room, disoriented. It coul he's just come out of a coma after seven months. Or it co he's a MONKEY unaccustomed to hanging out in a human body

dialogues.text: Stu?
